entries.title: This stalkerware tracked thousands of Android and iPhones
entries.description: A popular "stalkerware" app called Xnspy may be putting its victims' data at risk.

entries.title: JVC's 8K projector crowned best of 2022 by expert panel
entries.description: JVC's clean sweep in a recent high-profile test of top video projectors means we might now be ready for 8K.

entries.title: Google postpones Chrome content-blocker shakeup once again
entries.description: Manifest V3 continues to plague app functionality and those looking for effective adblockers, as well as privacy advocates.

entries.title: Sequoia breach sees hackers access customer Social Security numbers and COVID-19 test results
entries.description: The company promises 3 years’ free protection after personally identifiable data leaked.

entries.title: Apple's new Freeform app is one of its best software releases in years
entries.description: With Freeform available with iOS 16.2, macOS 13.1 and iPadOS 16.2, I went hands-on with it to see how well it works.

entries.title: Netflix's Kaleidoscope wants you to take part in its thrilling nonlinear heist plot
entries.description: The official trailer for Kaleidoscope has arrived – and it wants you to participate in Netflix's heist drama as you watch along.

entries.title: Nvidia RTX 4090 GPU spotted with new Raptor Lake CPU in gaming laptop
entries.description: If this leak is right, we’ll soon see a full range of Lovelace mobile GPUs, from the RTX 4060 up to the 4090.

entries.title: PlayStation Wrap-Up 2022 is here to bring you your annual dose of shame
entries.description: You’ll be rewarded an Astro Bot PlayStation Network profile image for sharing your stats with the rest of the community.

entries.title: Uber sees employee data leaked following cyberattack
entries.description: Attack on third party vendor means Uber appears to have suffered another data leak.

entries.title: This scam is seeing marketing e-mails opened en masse by bots
entries.description: A sizeable minority - 5% - of all marketing e-mails are opened by bots if new research is to be believed.

entries.title: Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse trailer is a wild who's who of Spider-People
entries.description: The official trailer for Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse has made me giddy with excitement.

entries.title: It's finally, almost, nearly the end for Windows 7 and 8...soon
entries.description: Windows 7 and 8/8.1 are losing another big backer as Microsoft Edge pulls support.

entries.title: The Witcher 3’s next-gen update fixes one of the game's most lethal issues
entries.description: The Witcher 3’s next-gen update should stop you from plummeting off small boulders to your death.

entries.title: The iPhone 14 finally works with one of the best Sonos speaker features
entries.description: Your iPhone 14 will now work with Trueplay auto-tuning, the best Sonos speaker feature.

entries.title: Microsoft says Teams isn't as bad as you think, actually
entries.description: Case against Microsoft Teams' market dominance continues, and Slack, Google Meet, and Zoom all have something to say.

entries.title: Android apps are being "poisoned" by this awful malware
entries.description: The ERMAC malware is back again, trying a new tactic to fool users that’s old news to us.

entries.title: Ethical hackers found even more vulnerabilities in 2022
entries.description: Vulnerabilities appear to have increased by over a fifth since last year, spurred on by businesses digitizing their operations

entries.title: Nvidia throws shade at AMD drivers as RDNA 3 GPUs are launched
entries.description: You might recall that Nvidia and AMD were butting heads over driver quality earlier this year, too.

entries.title: Where to buy the AMD Radeon RX 7900 XTX
entries.description: Here's where you can buy AMD's new flagship GPU, the RX 7900 XTX.

entries.title: Timothée Chalamet's Dune 2 filming reveal is the perfect present for Frank Herbert fans
entries.description: Dune: Part Two has finished principal photography, according to the film's leading man, Timothée Chalamet.

entries.title: CyberGhost drops password manager
entries.description: Export your CyberGhost passwords now or risk losing them forever - you’ve only got this month.

entries.title: Microsoft has reportedly offered Sony the rights to Call of Duty on PS Plus
entries.description: Microsoft has reportedly offered Sony the rights to add Call of Duty to PS Plus, should its proposed acquisition of Activision Blizzard go ahead.

entries.title: The high-quality mic in Astell & Kern’s new USB-C DAC dongle is ideal for PC gamers
entries.description: A&K's new travel-friendly audio booster also sports a headset input

entries.title: Strange World is already heading to Disney Plus – so what went wrong?
entries.description: Strange World has landed an earlier-than-expected Disney Plus release date. Why didn't it succeed in theaters?

entries.title: Don’t buy an iPhone 14 through Apple – there are much easier ways
entries.description: US shoppers are turning to carriers over Apple for their iPhones, and with good reason.

entries.title: LG's latest 27-inch OLED monitor hits that gaming sweet spot
entries.description: The new UltraGear monitor sports a 2K resolution display with a 240Hz refresh rate; exactly like the bigger model.
